summary:
With over 9 years of experience in marketing technology and more recently mobile app development (since April 2022), I am passionate about creating innovative and engaging social platforms that connect people with shared interests and values. I am the founder of Social Club Platform, a company that aims to build a variety of apps that cater to different themes, such as food, drinks, music, sports, and more.

My most recent app, Letslicious, is the first product of Social Club Platform, and it invites people who are interested in the food & drinks theme to meet like-minded others and discover new places and cuisines. I built this app using Firebase, Flutter/Dart, and SwiftUI, which are some of the skills that I have acquired on a side project during my full-time employment. I am always eager to learn new technologies and tools that can enhance the user experience and retention of my apps, as well as to explore new opportunities and partnerships that can expand the reach and impact of Social Club Platform.

I graduated as a business admin bachelor from University of Toronto where I learnt the crucial aspects of successful business stories. My goal is to achieve that success with Social Club Platform apps.

profile_positions.description: Created my first app, Letslicious, for iOS & Android. My goal is to build a platform where people meet like-minded others. Letslicious is the first app where I invite people who are interested in the food & drinks theme. It is free to use and I aim to help small business owners by connecting them with foodies, chefs, cooks, bakers, baristas, bartenders & more.
profile_positions.title: Founder

profile_positions.description:
•	Building global paid partnerships such as Tiktok, Reddit, Spotify in addition to running program tests for Uber's new bet programs like Reserve via Facebook, Google, Twitter.
•	Implementing and leading the global eater, rider, earner roadmaps and web/app campaigns to scale with most profitable strategies such as 100% return on ad spend for first time trips.
•	Creating internal and external playbooks for initiatives such as Facebook collaborative ads for which Uber does not spend any paid media and brings traffic by partner’s funds.
•	Managing the internship positions and supporting an agency to support different initiatives such as launching and testing airport related campaigns – brand activities.
profile_positions.title: Senior Marketing Technology Manager, Global

profile_positions.description:
• Replicating USCA cross selling approach that I worked on for the Switzerland market.
• Optimizing payment methods in order to attract new riders such as Google Pay, Apple Pay, Paypal etc...
profile_positions.title: Switzerland Local Operations assignment

profile_positions.description:
• Providing rider trip promotions for users who have used Uber Eats but have not taken any rides before.
• Targeting eaters based on their favorite restaurant in the last 3 months.
• Working with CRM team to send out comms in email, push and in app notifications.
profile_positions.title: USCA Uber Explore pilot assignment

profile_positions.description:
•	Working with the EMEA Central Ops team to optimise Upfront pricing for Uber rides. 
•	Analysing Uber EMEA pricing based on driver app usage with mapping providers such as Google, Waze and suggesting driver teams recommendations.
profile_positions.title: Rider Operations Assignment, EMEA

profile_positions.description:
•	Project managed what our global competition is doing in terms of providing additional earning opportunities to drivers.
•	Building a framework of solutions for LATAM region to implement local opportunities such as rooftop ads, car wraps, renting personal cars etc...
•	Working with business development team in order to align on the best interest for the local teams and their driver earnings.
profile_positions.title: Driver Operations Assignment, LATAM

profile_positions.description:
• Developing and executing the global eater, rider, driver, courier roadmaps in order to scale with most profitable strategies such as 100% return on ad spend.
• Working with Ops and CRM teams in order to scale owned channels such as email, app push and in-app communications in order to reach push comms about Uber's sustainability projects such as Uber Green.
• Testing & monitoring of various programs such as promos and new channels, if successful moving them to evergreen mode.
• Automating processes and using feeds in order to scale global programs.
profile_positions.title: Marketing Technology Manager, Global

profile_positions.description: •	Supported airport operations, new product launches such as Comfort for MENA region and ran a pricing analysis of our strategy vs. our competitor's approach on airport trips.
profile_positions.title: Rider Operations Assignment, MENA

profile_positions.description:
• Leading the execution of B2B (Driver, Courier, Restaurant, Uber for Business) performance campaigns with in EMEA.
• Implementing and managing airport rider performance & brand campaigns in order to bring new users & engage existing users (on Uber Rider App) who can take airport trips. 
• Working with external strategic partners in order to configure & automate best setup for our campaigns which includes taking advantage of their beta offers.
• Creating scalable dashboards with personalised automated views for EMEA & US teams (Rides & Eats) with budget and analytics caps by connecting automated reports from Google Sheets and Warehouse.
• Initiating digital partnerships in EMEA to co-sponsor our ads on other websites and putting a process which has been replicated for LATAM & APAC regions.
• Managing 2 agencies (US & UK) & putting processes in place for our team in order to have a good stakeholder management across different teams internally and externally.
• Organising monthly performance global alignment calls and keeping all regions up to date with my counterparts on the latest projects that EMEA team owns such as incrementality test via Analytics 360.
• Developing playbooks & quarterly updates for the projects that I have been leading on Eats & Rides.
• Collaborating with Google & Uber AP team in order to standardise the invoicing process & payments for regions that are billed to Uber BV (EMEA, LATAM, APAC, Canada, India).
profile_positions.title: Programmatic Manager, EMEA

profile_positions.description:
• Lead 3 different marketing channels (contextual, affiliate, native) through 5 different marketing platforms by optimizing them and reported directly to the global VP of performance marketing.
• Launched KAYAK's first affiliate networking program in Europe and negotiated with other platforms in order to run global campaigns to bring higher than 100% ROI.
• Managed day to day relationships with internal and external teams from all over the world such as marketing partners, product marketing managers, engineers, brand and performance managers.
• Provided weekly reports to the upper management as well as external teams such as marketing partners in order to show the internal performance metrics like revenue.
• Proactively made research on potential online marketing partners that can not only bring high ROI for our marketing attribution but also have automated solutions with their UX.
• Created A/B testing on different audiences, creatives, destinations, hotel properties to create specific user experience in order to increase the conversion rate.
• Worked with the brand team on new creative requests such as new locales launches for affiliate marketing networks or localization of banners.
profile_positions.title: Performance Marketing Manager, Global

profile_positions.description:
• Helped building Canada's first self-serve DSP (Demand Side Platform) solution and provided support to clients in terms of campaign launch and strategies.
• Trained and mentored 6 junior marketing analysts and self-serve clients on technical aspects of campaign management on our own DSP and SSPs including AppNexus Console such as setting up, optimization and troubleshooting.
• Owned the new SSP integrations with MediaMath, Facebook, Twitter and Instagram along with trafficking, setting up campaigns and billing our clients as well as piggybacking third party pixels to our ad serving tags including re-targeting and conversions.
• Led the process of purchasing, organizing and testing PMP opportunities where all the analysts tried different Deal IDs through our own demand side platform to boost performance of their campaigns.
• Reported weekly to the CEO on our ad exchange and SSP spends to make sure we were on track to meet our monthly and quarterly quotas.

My other daily duties were managing high important display and mobile campaigns such as Hyundai and GM, troubleshooting any issues related to set ups, creatives. I also created case studies on 2 big projects that I was leading - Deal IDs and Social ads.
profile_positions.title: Senior Analyst, North America

profile_positions.description:
Responsible on using in-house and AppNexus as well as DoubleClick/Google tech tools to manage online advertising campaigns with real-time data on the DSP side of the business. My daily activities included:

• Set up, monitored and optimized 30+ campaigns including prospecting, re-marketing, contextual and behavioural targeting in different platforms (display, mobile, pre-roll).
• Created weekly or final reports towards the client goals (CPA, ROI, CTR, CPC) to make effective recommendations for future projects.
• Worked closely with tech teams to help improve in-house technology platforms by providing requirements, new features, feedback and suggestions.
• Built strong relationships with ad exchange partners like DoubleClick, Rubicon, Pubmatic, AppNexus and Index in order to troubleshoot creative/campaign set ups.
• Created sampling tactics in order to advise account managers on specific RTB inventory.
• Updated display, mobile (web and in-app) and pre-roll premium site lists to serve top-notch impressions.
• Ensured monthly billing matching the campaign reports with the right exchange rate.

My favorite part of this experience was to use the latest digital advertising technology in the market and make sure the client expectations are exceeded for every project that I leaded.
profile_positions.title: Analyst, North America

profile_positions.description:
My role at Arbonne was to coordinate various digital campaigns and work with the Senior Product Marketing Manager as well as the Marketing Director. 

I was responsible on:
• Collaborating with different teams like IT, Sales, Web, Operations, Customer Service.
• Leading on Canadian website updates such as homepage banners and Facebook creatives
• Managing the SKU lifecycle of live and upcoming products. 
• Helping the creative team on digital marketing collaterals with the usage of basic HTML coding.

Another role I took over was updating the weekly product marketing newsletter copy. This update was crucial for the customer service representatives who needed the latest information on products. I also helped the QA team to approve any changes that would affect the production environment of the Canadian E-commerce website such as approving banners, creatives and purchasing process.

Last but not least, this role gave me the chance of working in a team where I collaborated with employees from the other offices located in the United States, England and Australia.
profile_positions.title: eCommerce Coordinator, Canada

profile_positions.description:
My role here was to assist the team members with my experience on how to improve their mental and physical skills. I stayed on court with many players to give them tips which helped the team to achieve successful results.

It was a great experience to see the extra effort every individual contributed even after a short but effective analysis of their tennis match.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Tennis Coach

profile_positions.description: Selected by many students to be eligible for an internship that allowed me to work while studying and making a presentation to my whole class.
profile_positions.title: Marketing Intern

profile_positions.description:
• 1-1 direct relationship management with hotel guests to fulfill their needs such as checking in, checking out.
• Working with internal stakeholders like housekeeping to make sure that all the rooms always exceed the customer expectations.
profile_positions.title: Receptionist

profile_positions.description:
With a team of 10 interns, I worked on the project “How to Improve Point of Purchase (POP) Materials”. We analyzed the way Coca Cola and their local competitors market their products in retail stores by preparing a SWOT analysis to increase awareness about the brand's products.

By the end of our internship, we made recommendations on redesigning the POP materials by creating samples on Coca Cola products and stands. We presented our ideas in front of the General Manager of Coca Cola Turkey. One of our ideas was implemented and had very good results (Living Surface).
profile_positions.title: Marketing Intern

profile_positions.description: Ranked 629 in the world juniors tennis.
profile_positions.title: Professional Athlete

volunteer_experiences.description: Volunteering to make public speaking speeches either prepared or impromptu on a bi-weekly basis.
